snippet: The new attempts to recoup money may hearten international backers by showing that the government is trying in good faith to recover money from those accused of bilking Kabul Bank.
abstract: Afghan Central Bank says that the government is stepping up efforts to recoup public money lost in the collapse of Kabul Bank, the nation's largest private financial institution; the development may hearten Afghan government's international backers, like the United States, by showing that it is trying in good faith to recover money from those accused of bilking Kabul Bank of some $900 million.
lead_paragraph: The new attempts to recoup money may hearten international backers by showing that the government is trying in good faith to recover money from those accused of bilking Kabul Bank.

headline.seo: Afghanistan Steps Up Efforts to Recover Kabul Bank’s Losses
headline.main: Afghanistan Widens Effort to Recoup Bank’s Assets
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Widens Effort to Recoup Bank’s Assets
